main_definition: To reload a weapon, device, or container with ammunition or content.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, to load new data into memory after the previous set has been used up or is no longer needed.
meanings_and_examples.example: After finishing a game session on his computer, Tom decided to reload and start again.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To refill a drink container with more liquid.
meanings_and_examples.example: When the water in her bottle ran out, Lisa had to recharge it by going to the fridge and reloading it with fresh water.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In video games, to load again after completing a level or finishing a mission.
meanings_and_examples.example: After defeating the boss in the final stage of his adventure game, Alex had to reload and try one more time to get all stars.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To replace spent ammunition with new rounds in firearms or other devices.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before engaging in another round of paintball games, players must recharge their guns by reloading the markers.
